H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3023.def: = state in which humans have lost their strength as a result of laborious work which requires a lot of energy, either physically or mentally

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H1677.def: = large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4120.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2543.def: = domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see {L:עַיִר<SDBH:עַיִר>}; female see {L:אָתֹון<SDBH:אָתֹון>}

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

glosses: to strangle oneself (with a rope around the neck)
H2614.def: = action by which humans kill themselves ◄ by cutting their air supply

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6912.def: = to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

52.gl: to strangle oneself (with a rope around the neck)

H4266.def: = town; ◄ territory of {L:Gad<SDBH:גָּד>}; ► assigned to clan of {L:Merari<SDBH:מְרָרִי>}, tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; capital of kingdom of {L:Isboseth<SDBH:אִישׁ־בֹּשֶׁת>} son of {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6021.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Jether<SDBH:יֶתֶר>} and {L:Abigail<SDBH:אֲבִיגַיִל>}, sister of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; ► army commander

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H3097.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Zeruiah<SDBH:צְרוּיָה>}, sister of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; ► chief of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}'s army

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3501.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H26.def: = woman, also known as {L:Abigal<SDBH:אֲבִיגַל>}; ► wife of {L:Nabal<SDBH:נָבָל>}, who later married king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H5176.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

8.gl: to place (in a position) > to appoint

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2583.def: = state in which an individual or group of people dwells at a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H4266.def: = town; ◄ territory of {L:Gad<SDBH:גָּד>}; ► assigned to clan of {L:Merari<SDBH:מְרָרִי>}, tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; capital of kingdom of {L:Isboseth<SDBH:אִישׁ־בֹּשֶׁת>} son of {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H5176.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H7237.def: = town, also known as {L:Rabbah of the Ammonites<SDBH:רַב>}, ◄ and located in Ammon; ► capital of the Ammonite kingdom, first conquered by {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} on their way from {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}, and later again by {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H5988.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gemalli<SDBH:גְּמַלִּי>}; tribe of {L:Dan<SDBH:דָּן>}; ► one of the twelve men sent by {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>} to spy out the land

H3810.def: = town; ► located east of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>} river in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; assigned to tribe of {L:Gad<SDBH:גָּד>}

H1271.def: = man; ◄ from {L:Rogelim<SDBH:רֹגְלִים>} in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ► an elder who supported king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H1569.def: = inhabitant or descendant of {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}, tribe and territory of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H5592.def: = receptacle of undetermined size; ◄ made out of metal; ► used both for household and religious purposes

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H7058.def: = flour made from ground grain kernels, ► used for baking bread, as ingredient for food, and as grain offering

H7039.def: = ears of grain that have been cooked over a fire ► to form a meal that can be carried conveniently when traveling or working outside

H6321.def: = product of an erect plant, not a vine, reaching to 1 meter (3 feet) in height; its stem branches only in the upper part, and it has no tendrils; it has white flowers that, when they ripen, form pods containing 3-6 large flat beans of a cream or tan color; ◄ Vicia faba or Faba vulgaris; ► used for food

H5742.def: = type of vegetable from a low-branched plant with a weak stem; its flowers develop into a short pod with only one seed inside, about the size of a small pea, one type of which is reddish brown in color; ◄ Lens culinaris; ► typically used in soups and stews

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H2529.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H8194.def: = substance ◄ made out of pressed curds of cow milk, ► used as food

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H6771.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
